snippet: James Glover, 52, spent years in prison before turning his life around; now he is married and has earned a culinary arts internship.
abstract: Community Service Society, one of the beneficiary agencies of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, helps ex-convict James Glover of Harlem earn a culinary arts internship on the Upper West Side.
lead_paragraph: James Glover, 52, spent years in prison before turning his life around; now he is married and has earned a culinary arts internship.

headline.seo: Once a Hustler, Now a Family Man Aspiring to Cook
headline.main: From Street Hustler to Family Man Eager to Cook
headline.print_headline: From Street Hustler to Family Man Eager to Cook
